data.event: It is the fourth post-World War II new town to be built in Scotland, designated in 1962.

event.title: was built around a collection of small villages, Livingston Village, Bellsquarry and Livingston Station (now

data.event: It was built around a collection of small villages, Livingston Village, Bellsquarry and Livingston Station (now part of Deans).
The 2011 census showed the population of Livingston had increased to 56,269.
